name: Archway Motels

reviews.text: After a long day on the road (and walking tracksof the south island!) theres nothing better than checking into a motel with great service, friendly smiles and a very comfy and accomodating room.
reviews.title: Best place in Wanaka for a family to stay - wonderful service too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The archway motel has all these things in spades. The hosts go well out of their way to mkae you feel at home, the facilities are great and the rooms are spacious and very cosy. Travelling with 7 of us (3 adults, 3 kids and 1 bub) we all fitted easily into the 2 bedrom appartment and slept like logs. Its warm, the beds are comfy and I have wonderful memories of making dinner for us all while the kids jumped, giggled and sang on the trampoline outside in the setting sun and glowing autumn leaves.
reviews.title: friendly, comfortable place to stay

reviews.text: The thing that seals the deal is the value, the Archway has fantastic rates given the amout of room and the facilities you get. This is a comfy, cosy, welcoming and relaxing place to stay, where the whole family will be happy and hosts are top notch. You wont find a more memorable place to stay in Wanaka.
reviews.title: Southern hospitality

reviews.text: We stayed 1 night in April 2012, We wished we stayed longer... very friendly reception on arrival, a very well equipped kitchen, a comfortable bed and close to everything.highly recommend
reviews.title: Wise choice

reviews.text: I stayed five nights in April while at Autumn Art School, The unit was spacious, clean and fresh with attractive furnishings. I was able to cook with the stovetop and microwave and it was in a great location to get to the school each day. On top of having a lovely place to call home for five days, hosts Brigit and Paul were extremely friendly and went out of their way to help me. Hoping to be back next year.
reviews.title: Lovely and friendly, clean with good facilities, value for money.

reviews.text: Stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for one night. Comfortable, well-equipped and quiet motel just 10 minutes walk from the centre of Wanaka. The host was very friendly and helpful. There is also a very friendly cat in residence.
reviews.title: Good motel

reviews.text: We planned to stay in Wanaka for 2 nights and ended up with two self-contained, 2-bedroom units at the Archway Motel as we wanted 2 bathrooms for 4 adults. The wood panelling made the place feel dark and dingy, but overall it was clean and the kitchen was well equipped. Each unit had a double bed and 2 singles. The bedrooms were small with minimal space for luggage so we used the living area for our bags. The bed was well slept in and we tended to roll into the middle - hence did not sleep well. We used the BBQ and laundry, and also 30 mins WiFi for each room. One of the units had a large fridge and a dishwasher - ours only had a small bar fridge. Hairdryer was provided but only one bedroom had a mirror near a socket.
reviews.title: Older style motel
OK
reviews.text: Imagine 1960's holiday camp accomodation and this is what rooms 1 - 9 are like. However rooms 10 - 16 are the rustic log cabins (built in 1990's) that alot of the TA reviews refer to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having said that, our room (4) had all the equipment we needed and it's a 15 minute walk (downhill) into town (restaurants / lake etc), so was situated in a convenient location. Paper thin walls to the units but there's a policy of no noise outside after 10pm, so we slept quite well. Owners helpful and onsite all the time.
reviews.title: Large rustic room close to town
Unexpected Surprise
reviews.text: This place is one of the largest rooms we had in a month of traveling in NZ. Wood paneling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked an economy studio for two single night stays while travelling to/from Doubtful sound.
reviews.title: Cheap and Cheerful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price was low enough for us to be a little worried about exactly what we were going to get but there was absolutely no problem. Although old and a little dated the units are large, clean, well equipped and everything works. As a bonus the reception is welcoming and helpful. In fact we recommended the Archway to another couple we met on our travels.
reviews.title: Well worth it.

reviews.text: Plenty of space in a large studio unit. The kitchen and dining area were larger than most. There are BBQ facilities outside as well. It was an easy walk to the town center, restaurants, shops and the lake. All units are on the ground floor, and parking is right outside your door. The host and hostess were very helpful with suggestions for tourists.
reviews.title: Basin with double taps?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a night and our room was very spacious. However we find it weird that the bathroom basin has 2 taps; one hot and one cold. As it was winter, the cold water was extremely cold... We had to use the basin at the pantry to wash up instead. Heater in the room has a timer and it was irritating.
reviews.title: Worth for the Money

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in studio room. One of the fantastic stay we had in our NZ trip. The hosts were very kind and helpful. The rooms were very spacious and it had everthing possible inside, including towel warmer. Its kind of Hotel + Motel facilities. the property itself was very beautiful with many colorful trees. Try the green apple from their apple tree, it was amazingly delicious. My stay there was worth for the money.
reviews.title: Wonderful Wanaka Welcome!!!

reviews.text: We stayed one night in a unit that has 2 rooms and a shared bathroom, lounge and kitchen. First thing to note is this is probably the most spacious place we've stayed in. There were 4 of us and at no time did we feel we were in each others way. Place is a tad bit old but this just added to the older cottage feel. Management was very welcoming and friendly. We will be back here when we come to Wanaka again.
reviews.title: Nice and cozy

reviews.text: Our welcome was warm and informative. The room was clean and suitably appointed, only let down by the amount of varnished wood!
reviews.title: Yeh - stay here again.

reviews.text: It looked a bit dated but only in terms of presentation not repair. We were put in a disabled unit which mean't the shower was designed for wheelchair - this felt a bit weird but once again there was nothing physically wrong with it.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is excellent. The DOC office is just across the road, shops five minutes walk away, while the town and lake front is 10 minutes away. It is also easy to find in the first place.
reviews.title: Friendly owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Made use of the laundry and discovered a room full of useful stuff like car washing stuff! (Handy for getting the dust off your hire car from those unsealed roads your not surpost to go on...)
reviews.title: Good motel

description: Welcome to your-"Home away from Home" Archway motel is set in 2 acres of grounds and tree-lined hillside. Only 5 minutes walk to the lake- we offer quiet, comfortable & spacious accommodation with mountain and bush outlooks.All units are ground-floor,non-smoking, are self-contained (kitchens/bathrooms), serviced daily and offer a range of studio- king, Queen & single bed units-many redecorated and enjoy our private rustic chalets. We also have 4 2/3 bedroom family units with King/Queen beds along with 3/4 single beds.Services & facilities include-Free Wi-Fi allocation,Internet computer with Skype also available, office/business services, DVDs & free DVD library. Large grounds/outdoor seating areas, 8 BBQ's,large playground.Soak & relax in New hillside cedar hot tubs with bush or panoramic views of the surrounding mountains & golf-course.(Fee normally applies but watch for inclusive offers/ package deals)Experience warm, southern hospitality with your Hosts- Bridgit & Paul. We are here to help make your visit the best it can be!
